name: Ahi Tuna Tartare with Wasabi Aioli
author: Love2Cook
summary: This is by far the best tuna tartare recipe I've tried. It's always a hit and a little goes a long way. It's very easy to make but looks very sophisticated. Enjoy!
ingredients: ½ pound sashimi-grade ahi tuna, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 tablespoon nori fumi furikake (seaweed and sesame rice seasoning)
¼ cup finely diced red onion
directions: Combine tuna, peanut oil, furikake, and wasabi powder in a bowl
Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours
Mix water and 1/2 teaspoon wasabi powder together in a medium bowl
Stir in mayonnaise, chives, and lime juice
Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours
Top tortilla chips with tuna tartare, avocado, and red onion
Drizzle wasabi aioli lightly over the top
